text: Hello and welcome.
Uh my name is Frederick Nielsen. I'm uh
in product management at Epic Games. I
got my start in broadcast graphics. Uh I
then found and fell in love with
character animation for both feature
animation and video games. Even though
now I'm in product, I still try and find
I still try and find time to actually
animate here and there. Helps me test

creative outlet.
Um, at Epic, we get to make really fun

people both internally and externally.
We deploy new versions of the tools and

Okay, so let's start with the curve

our toolbar. We've consolidated icons

around. We've embedded a fully
redesigned tween slider right on right
on top of the editor there. I'll get
back to that one in a second. We've
added a new lattice tool for scaling and
adjusting your key frames. We've added
smart key snapping, paste relative, and
so much more.
If we look at some of these things
together, um you can see here the
changes to the toolbar as I click
through it.
Um smart key snapping. So what this is
doing is it's keying whole frames and
removing closest subframes. So it's a
quick way to kind of clean up your
motion.
And then the new lattice tool, too,
which lets you select a whole bunch of
keys and skew them and pull on corners.
And uh even it has flipping
functionality, which uh I can show
later. You can double click and flip
your curves really quickly, too. So,
twin tools.
So, we had an earlier version of these
um but we've reworked them and made them

curve editor.
These are the sliders we currently have.
Some of you may notice a new one that we

shifts your animation by adjusting

look look to continue to add more
sliders in the future.
Uh many animators these days have come
to rely heavily rely on these tools. So
we've been meaning to get back in here.
We've added new hotkeys for driving

anywhere in your viewport hold the
hotkey and drive the slider.
Uh, and that works both in the curve

motion trails. So these have also been

You can switch between various looks and

way faster and more responsive. Uh and
these keys are of course fully editable
in your viewport as well. So you can
single select keys and manipulate them
or even multi- select keys and

Our pinning system has been overhauled

you want to add another uh motion trail
to something, you'll have to add it to

You can display trails on things with
keys or even without keys, uh, including

How about an details?
So, this is our channel box. Uh, this

select your channels. You can adjust the

you can you can adjust sorry uh you can

Viewport tools.

We've added mirroring tools. Um, we've

performance was another key pillar for

playback has been optimized and sped up

don't need to see them while they're
while your scene is playing.
We even tweaked code um we tweaked some

posing.
In addition to all the other fixes to
